intro: Barrosoa betoniciformis, commonly known as the Brazilian betony, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
